13.text: MIT offers a "pirate certificate" to students who complete four physical education courses.

files.f1: MIT offers a "pirate certificate" to students who complete four physical education courses.

evidences.text: Since the Fall semester of 2011, the university’s Physical Education department has been handing out physical “pirate certificates” to any student — undergraduate or graduate — who has successfully completed courses in archery, fencing, pistol/rifle shooting and sailing.

14.text: Justin Timberlake said that “The whole concept of mandatory vaccination schedules is un-American.”

files.f1: Justin Timberlake said that “The whole concept of mandatory vaccination schedules is un-American.”

evidences.text: This story originated with, and was solely reported by, YourNewsWire, a clickbait fake news site.

15.text: A woman seeking to bring her peacock along on a flight as an emotional support animal was denied permission to do so by United Airlines.

files.f1: A woman seeking to bring her peacock along on a flight as an emotional support animal was denied permission to do so by United Airlines.

evidences.text: In late January 2018, Jet Set TV, a travel talk show, reported on their Facebook page that an unidentified woman and her emotional support peacock were unable to board their flight out of Newark Liberty International Airport.

16.text: President Donald Trump ordered the removal of Barack Obama’s name from a Florida highway.

files.f1: President Donald Trump ordered the removal of Barack Obama’s name from a Florida highway.

evidences.text: Rumor comes from a false headline attached to a 2015 opinion piece critical of the name change. It is still named President Barack Obama Highway.

17.text: Chuck Schumer took $500,000 in donations from immigrant advocacy groups before the government shutdown?

files.f1: Chuck Schumer took $500,000 in donations from immigrant advocacy groups before the government shutdown?

evidences.text: Rumor originated on a satirical website. There is no evidence that he received $500,000 in campaign contributions from immigration advocacy groups.

18.text: Denzel Washington called Barack Obama the “criminal-in-chief”

files.f1: Denzel Washington called Barack Obama the “criminal-in-chief”

evidences.text: The story was first posted on YourNewsWire.com, which has posted fabricated stories about celebrities allegedly espousing conservative views before.

19.text: 11 terrorists arrested in a late-night raid at a mosque.

files.f1: 11 terrorists arrested in a late-night raid at a mosque.

evidences.text: Website that describes itself as satirical posted a story claiming that “11 ‘very dangerous men’ who aren’t supposed to be in America at all have been apprehended plotting what would have been our next 9-11.”

20.text: Food and Drug Administration announced that vaccines cause autism

files.f1: Food and Drug Administration announced that vaccines cause autism

evidences.text: The Food and Drug Administration credits vaccines for the decline of many infectious diseases over the last century, and more than a decade of peer-reviewed studies show there is no link between their use and autism.

21.text: Did President Donald Trump shut down a service dog training program for veterans?

files.f1: Did President Donald Trump shut down a service dog training program for veterans?

evidences.text: The Walter Reed National Military Medical Center has ended its partnership with a nonprofit organization that pairs service dogs with veterans. It wasn’t a White House decision.

22.text: NASA confirmed that there will be 15 days of darkness on Earth in 2018.

files.f1: NASA confirmed that there will be 15 days of darkness on Earth in 2018.

evidences.text: The website twofeed.org posted a story with the headline “NASA confirms Earth will experience 15 days of darkness in November 2017.” Facebook users flagged this story as potentially fake news. It is.

23.text: Was Malia Obama fired from an internship for smoking marijuana? Was she arrested for buying marijuana in Chicago?

files.f1: Was Malia Obama fired from an internship for smoking marijuana? Was she arrested for buying marijuana in Chicago?

evidences.text: Obama, who will be a freshman at Harvard University in the fall, reportedly interned at the American Embassy in Madrid during the summer of 2016, not 2017. And there were no legitimate news reports about her being fired.

24.text: The members of Congress get full pay having served just one term in office.

files.f1: The members of Congress get full pay having served just one term in office.

evidences.text: Only senators are eligible for a pension after one term, but it won’t be their full salary.

25.text: The man who killed more than two dozen people in a rural Texas church trying to start a civil war as a member of antifa

files.f1: The man who killed more than two dozen people in a rural Texas church trying to start a civil war as a member of antifa

evidences.text: Law enforcement officials believe the mass shooting was motivated by a family dispute, and they are not investigating it as an act of terrorism.

26.text: President Donald Trump repealed a rule that aims to block some people with mental disorders from buying guns.

files.f1: President Donald Trump repealed a rule that aims to block some people with mental disorders from buying guns.

evidences.text: The Social Security Administration is no longer required to submit the names of certain mentally disabled beneficiaries to a federal agency that conducts gun background checks.

27.text: Winston Churchill was born in a ladies’ room during a dance.

files.f1: Winston Churchill was born in a ladies’ room during a dance.

evidences.text: There is  nothing more remarkable than that he was born two months prematurely in a “singularly bleak-looking bedroom” at Blenheim Palace according to the his Biography written by Roy Jenkins.

links.url: Jenkins, Roy.   Churchill: A Biography. New York: Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 2001.    ISBN 0-374-12354-3   (p. 5).

28.text: Eating six or seven bananas at once can result in death from a lethal potassium overdose.

files.f1: Eating six or seven bananas at once can result in death from a lethal potassium overdose.

evidences.text: The amount of potassium one takes in from eating a single banana is about 422 mg, while the recommended daily allowance (RDA) of potassium for adults is about 4,700 mg per day.

29.text: A worker at a Pepsi or Frooti plant has contaminated those beverage products by injecting HIV-infected blood into them.

files.f1: A worker at a Pepsi or Frooti plant has contaminated those beverage products by injecting HIV-infected blood into them.

evidences.text: No news accounts, government agencies, or other reliable sources have reported Pepsi or Frooti products being contaminated with HIV-infected blood.

30.text: Dunkin' Donuts is offering free coffee to teachers every Monday in September.

files.f1: Dunkin' Donuts is offering free coffee to teachers every Monday in September.

evidences.text: It was a local restaurant promotion in Minooka, Illinois only in 2014

31.text: Drinking cocktails from a copper mug might cause copper poisoning.

files.f1: Drinking cocktails from a copper mug might cause copper poisoning.

evidences.text: Any acidic drink corrodes copper in a mug, which leaches back into the drink, increasing the level of copper in it, which could potentially cause copper poisoning and its associated symptoms.

32.text: Margarine was originally manufactured to fatten turkeys.

files.f1: Margarine was originally manufactured to fatten turkeys.

evidences.text: Margarine was not invented as a turkey fattener. It was formulated in 1869 by Hippolyte Mège Mouriès of France in response to Napoleon III’s offering of a prize to whoever could succeed at producing a viable low-cost substitute for butter.

33.text: The FBI has warned all Americans to be cautious of produce at grocery stores that might have been sprayed with poison.

files.f1: The FBI has warned all Americans to be cautious of produce at grocery stores that might have been sprayed with poison.

evidences.text: The newspaper didn’t say the FBI issued a general warning about grocery store produce in the affected area (or anywhere else), just that the Michigan Department of Agriculture and Rural Development [MDARD] had advised residents of the Ann Arbor region to discard foods that had been “purchased from salad bars, olive bars and ready-to-eat hot and cold food areas from these stores between mid-March and the end of April”

34.text: Did Aunt Jemima Recall Some Frozen Pancake Products Over Listeria Concerns?

files.f1: Did Aunt Jemima Recall Some Frozen Pancake Products Over Listeria Concerns?

evidences.text: Pinnacle Foods recalled several products, including Aunt Jemima pancakes and waffles, over Listeria concerns.

35.text: Photographs show a rare strain of blue strawberries.

files.f1: Photographs show a rare strain of blue strawberries.

evidences.text: Fake photos made for click bait stories and wrong advertising by seed sellers.

36.text: Discolored Bananas Are Dangerous to Humans?

files.f1: Discolored Bananas Are Dangerous to Humans?

evidences.text: Although the discoloration may make bananas seem visually unappealing to consumers, there is no real health risk to humans who eat such bananas.

37.text: Black and white caterpillars can cause severe allergic reactions in some people who touch them.

files.f1: Black and white caterpillars can cause severe allergic reactions in some people who touch them.

evidences.text: The caterpillar excretes a type of chemical defense upon contact (which is more ‘allergenic’ than ‘poisonous’).

38.text: A photograph shows a real hammerhead salamander.

files.f1: A photograph shows a real hammerhead salamander.

evidences.text: Although the diplocaulus was, indeed, a real animal that lived during the Permian period, the amphibian has not been present on Earth for about a few hundred million years. Therefore, it is highly unlikely that a real, living diplocaulus was captured on camera, the image actually depicts a model of a diplocaulus created by artist Goro Furuta.

39.text: A photograph shows John Lennon and Che Guevara playing guitar together.

files.f1: A photograph shows John Lennon and Che Guevara playing guitar together.

evidences.text: The original photo shows the Beatles singer playing guitar with Wayne “Tex” Gabriel.

40.text: The term "Black Friday" originated with the practice of selling off slaves on the day after Thanksgiving.

files.f1: The term "Black Friday" originated with the practice of selling off slaves on the day after Thanksgiving.

evidences.text: The earliest known use of “Black Friday” in such a context stems from 1951 and referred to the practice of workers calling in sick on the day after Thanksgiving.

41.text: President Trump and President Obama wrote in the Yad Yashem guest book.

files.f1: President Trump and President Obama wrote in the Yad Yashem guest book.

evidences.text: A graphic purportedly showing the messages penned by President Trump and President Obama during their respective visits to Yad Vashem, Israel’s memorial to the victims of the Holocaust, appeared on social media in May 2017.

42.text: Man in Sweden Died From Penis Enhancement Surgery

files.f1: Man in Sweden Died From Penis Enhancement Surgery

evidences.text: On 31 July 2017, reports appeared that a 30-year-old man had died from a fat embolism after undergoing penis enhancement surgery in Sweden.

43.text: Man on Crystal Meth Kills 12 Neighbors, Thinking They're Zombies?

files.f1: Man on Crystal Meth Kills 12 Neighbors, Thinking They're Zombies?

evidences.text: The photograph of the killing spree “suspect” that accompanied these articles was previously used online to illustrate a report about a man who was allegedly arrested trying to rob a bank after paying a wizard $500 to make him invisible.

44.text: Muslims comprise 1% of the U.S. population

files.f1: Muslims comprise 1% of the U.S. population

evidences.text: Estimate from the Pew Research Center reported that Muslims made up about 1% of the total U.S. population in 2015.

45.text: An elementary school in Fresno, California, forced a third-grader to remove a cap bearing Donald Trump's campaign slogan.

files.f1: An elementary school in Fresno, California, forced a third-grader to remove a cap bearing Donald Trump's campaign slogan.

evidences.text: Nine-year-old Logan Autry says his school forced him to remove his "Make America Great Again" cap because it upset other students.

46.text: It is illegal to take photographs of the Eiffel Tower at night without explicit permission.

files.f1: It is illegal to take photographs of the Eiffel Tower at night without explicit permission.

evidences.text: The light show, added in 1985, is considered an artistic display and is indeed protected by copyright.

47.text: The "Atlas Shrugged" author called government handouts "immoral" received Social Security Benefits?

files.f1: The "Atlas Shrugged" author called government handouts "immoral" received Social Security Benefits?

evidences.text: Despite arguing that government benefits constitute an immoral redistribution of wealth, Ayn Rand received Social Security payouts later in life.

48.text: Van Halen's Concert Contract Required No Brown M&Ms?

files.f1: Van Halen's Concert Contract Required No Brown M&Ms?

evidences.text: Van Halen's standard performance contract contained a provision calling for them to be provided backstage with a bowl of M&Ms from which all the brown candies has been removed.

49.text: "The Simpsons" depicted that President Donald Trump would touch a glowing orb fifteen years before he actually did so during a trip to the Middle East

files.f1: "The Simpsons" depicted that President Donald Trump would touch a glowing orb fifteen years before he actually did so during a trip to the Middle East

evidences.text: The Simpsons image is not from a 2002 episode, rather, the screenshot comes from a short video posted to “The Simpsons” Facebook page on 26 May 2017 (after Trump’s visit to Saudi Arabia). The “picture” can be seen on a wall leading up to the office of Vice President Mike Pence at the 6 second mark of the following video.

50.text: A photograph shows two great white sharks swimming in the Mississippi River.

files.f1: A photograph shows two great white sharks swimming in the Mississippi River.

evidences.text: This photograph has been circulating since at least 2008, when it was posted to Flickr along with the caption “Bull Shark — Rio Sirena River Mouth.

51.text: Mark Zuckerberg's $150 million ultra-luxury super yacht.

files.f1: Mark Zuckerberg's $150 million ultra-luxury super yacht.

evidences.text: False claim which ran in the Hurriyet Daily News.

52.text: Did Hurricane Irma Draw the Water Away from Beaches in Florida and the Bahamas?

files.f1: Did Hurricane Irma Draw the Water Away from Beaches in Florida and the Bahamas?

evidences.text: Hurricane Irma had the effect of drawing water away from stretches of coastline in Florida and the Bahamas.

53.text: Dead Bigfoot Confirmed at Elephant Butte Lake, NM?

files.f1: Dead Bigfoot Confirmed at Elephant Butte Lake, NM?

evidences.text: Published by “prank” web site BreakingNews365.net, which allows users to create their own fake news stories and carries a disclaimer:

54.text: Farmers feed their cows with candy, such as Skittles.

files.f1: Farmers feed their cows with candy, such as Skittles.

evidences.text: This practice has been going on for several years.  In 2012, CNN reported that several farmers had started feeding their cattle candy due to a corn shortage:

55.text: A 9-year-old killed his parents after they turned off wi-fi in their home.

files.f1: A 9-year-old killed his parents after they turned off wi-fi in their home.

evidences.text: The photograph included with the article doesn’t show a 9-year-old who killed his parents after they shut off the Wi-fi. This image actually shows a teenager who was arrested for breaking into cars in September 2015.

56.text: Protester holding a "No mother should have to fear for her son's life every time he robs a store" sign

files.f1: Protester holding a "No mother should have to fear for her son's life every time he robs a store" sign

evidences.text: An image showing a Ferguson protester holding a controversial sign is a digital fabrication. The original photograph was taken by Mitch Ryals and was published in the Riverfront Times on 1 October 2014.

57.text: Is This Footage of a Giant Chicken Real?

files.f1: Is This Footage of a Giant Chicken Real?

evidences.text: Although many viewers are familiar only with smaller breeds of chickens (the average broiler chicken weighs about six pounds), some breeds such as the Brahma can grow to weigh close to 20 pounds.

58.text: Are Motorists Finding HIV-Infected Needles on Gas Pump Handles?

files.f1: Are Motorists Finding HIV-Infected Needles on Gas Pump Handles?

evidences.text: A hoax urging service station customers to exercise caution when pumping gas appeared first on the Internet in early June 2000, Although there have been a few isolated reports of copycat pranksters leaving needles in public places (including gas pumps, such as an incident in May 2017) in the wake of this hoax, none of those incidents has involved a needle bearing any traces of HIV.

59.text: Charles and Elizabeth Koch contributed nearly $500,000 to Paul Ryan’s fundraising committee after successfully passing the GOP tax plan in the United States House of Representatives.

files.f1: Charles and Elizabeth Koch contributed nearly $500,000 to Paul Ryan’s fundraising committee after successfully passing the GOP tax plan in the United States House of Representatives.

evidences.text: Charles and Elizabeth Koch donated $247,000 apiece to Paul Ryan’s fundraising campaign, “Team Ryan,” according to filings published by investigative journalism outfit ProPublica.

60.text: Did a Pizza Hut Manager Disparage U.S. Servicemembers?

files.f1: Did a Pizza Hut Manager Disparage U.S. Servicemembers?

evidences.text: According to a 15 January 2017 news report from Huntsville television station WAFF, after Pizza Hut investigated the report and determined the incident it described was fabricated.

61.text: Muhammad Ali With a Young Michael Jackson?

files.f1: Muhammad Ali With a Young Michael Jackson?

evidences.text: The picture was taken at Ali’s training camp in Pennsylvania and shows the legendary fighter with Tiger Smalls, a young boxer who achieved some notoriety for another photograph showing him “punching” the champion.

62.text: Did Dolly Parton Say: 'Trump In One Year Is Already Better Than 16 Years of Bush, Obama Put Together’?

files.f1: Did Dolly Parton Say: 'Trump In One Year Is Already Better Than 16 Years of Bush, Obama Put Together’?

evidences.text: It was actually a paraphrase of an opinion expressed by Brett Decker during a radio interview on 5 January 2018.

113.text: Will Robert Mueller Be Forced to Resign Over an Affair with Nancy Pelosi?

files.f1: Will Robert Mueller Be Forced to Resign Over an Affair with Nancy Pelosi?

evidences.text: This story originated with Ladies of Liberty, a site that is part of a network of fake news sites dedicated to spreading political misinformation under the guise of proffering “satire.”

114.text: Did Trump's Doctor Say the President Was 'Too Sick to Talk to Mueller'?

files.f1: Did Trump's Doctor Say the President Was 'Too Sick to Talk to Mueller'?

evidences.text: Andy Borowitz wrote the satirical news for the New Yorker on Jan. 24, 2018, reporting that Trump’s doctor gave him a note to avoid talking to Mueller

115.text: The flu shot makes you sick to begin with.

files.f1: The flu shot makes you sick to begin with.

evidences.text: Flu shots work by introducing dead (inactivated) strains of influenza virus, which trigger your immune system to create antibodies to fight those strains. These antibodies make your body more prepared to fight if should it be exposed to an active strain in the future. Because the strains are inactive, any sickness you develop after the shot is not caused by influenza, according to the Harvard Medical School.

116.text: Did Sen. Tom Cotton Issue a 'Cease and Desist' Letter to a Constituent?

files.f1: Did Sen. Tom Cotton Issue a 'Cease and Desist' Letter to a Constituent?

evidences.text: Caroline Rabbitt Tabler, confirmed the existence of the letters, saying that they were issued “under extreme circumstances.”

117.text: Are Farmers Injecting Fruits and Vegetables with Oxytocin?

files.f1: Are Farmers Injecting Fruits and Vegetables with Oxytocin?

evidences.text: The practice, which is illegal in both India and around the world, does not appear to be widespread outside of India, and no available scientific studies rigorously demonstrate how common its use is in India (or anywhere else).

118.text: A photograph shows a mountain that closely resembles a frozen elephant.

files.f1: A photograph shows a mountain that closely resembles a frozen elephant.

evidences.text: The foreground of the image, which shows a field and a few scattered bushes, was taken from a photograph of a Rocca Malatestiana, a fortress on a mountain range in Italy. It was created from two images on Pixabay.

119.text: Has Pluto Been Officially Reclassified as a Planet?

files.f1: Has Pluto Been Officially Reclassified as a Planet?

evidences.text: Ever since the controversial August 2006 decision by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) to downgrade Pluto to a dwarf planet.  It was april fools days joke by Futurism.com

120.text: Do People in Sweden Have to Sign a 'Consent Form' Before Having Sex?

files.f1: Do People in Sweden Have to Sign a 'Consent Form' Before Having Sex?

evidences.text: The photograph included in Survive Our Collapse’s post is a hoax. The earliest example we could find was in a February 2015 post on the “Gorgeous Active Duty Females – U.S.” Facebook page.

121.text: A video shows Pope Francis dancing merengue.

files.f1: A video shows Pope Francis dancing merengue.

evidences.text: Video posted by Fredy Gonzalez, This footage shows a man dressed up in a pope costume at a Halloween party. In the video, you can clearly see Halloween decorations (a large spider and cobwebs) on the ceiling and a couple dressed as skeletons on the dance floor.

122.text: Do FBI Agents Have an Anti-Trump 'Secret Society'?

files.f1: Do FBI Agents Have an Anti-Trump 'Secret Society'?

evidences.text: It was a joke referencing not the planning stages of a secret society meeting but a Vladimir Putin-themed calendar.

123.text: Does Iceland Pay $5,000 Per Month to Immigrants Who Marry Icelandic Women?

files.f1: Does Iceland Pay $5,000 Per Month to Immigrants Who Marry Icelandic Women?

evidences.text: Iceland has a surfeit of men, not women, and the Icelandic government has never offered grants to immigrants for marrying Icelanders, regardless of gender.

124.text: Is 'Bluetooth' Technology Named After a Viking King?

files.f1: Is 'Bluetooth' Technology Named After a Viking King?

evidences.text: The king Harald who won for himself all Denmark and Norway, and made the Danes Christian, that unity made Bluetooth an appealing working name, since it securely builds networks. It is thought that his nickname was Blåtand (Blátǫnn in Old Norse), meaning Blue Tooth, because he had a dead tooth that had turned bluish.  The name is worked into the logo, as well: in it, you can see the Nordic runes that form the letters H and B, which stand for “Harald” and “Bluetooth.”

125.text: Is a Kentucky University Giving Black Students Free Tuition as an "Apology" for Slavery?

files.f1: Is a Kentucky University Giving Black Students Free Tuition as an "Apology" for Slavery?

evidences.text: Western Kentucky University's Student Government Association voted to give black students "full and free access" to the college. The vote was largely intended to be symbolic, and the university has confirmed it will not be implementing it as policy.

126.text: Keanu Reeves overcame a series of tragic events in his life, before and after becoming a wealthy movie star.

files.f1: Keanu Reeves overcame a series of tragic events in his life, before and after becoming a wealthy movie star.

evidences.text: At age 23, his best friend River Phoenix died of a drug overdose. In 1999, the love of his life, Jennifer Syme, was pregnant with their daughter. But the child was stillborn, and it cost them their relationship. 18 months later, Jennifer was killed in a car accident. He attended 4 different high schools and struggled with dyslexia, making education very difficult.

127.text: Was Ivanka Trump Critically Injured After Being Shot by a Sniper?

files.f1: Was Ivanka Trump Critically Injured After Being Shot by a Sniper?

evidences.text: The President’s daughter has appeared in public on several occasions since the article was posted on 5 January 2018, seemingly in good health.

128.text: IKEA released a magazine ad which includes a pregnancy test.

files.f1: IKEA released a magazine ad which includes a pregnancy test.

evidences.text: Swedish agency Åkestam Holst, Adweek’s International Agency of the Year for 2017  released and confirmed.

129.text: A woman named Shanell Rivers put blood and dog feces into various products at a Starbucks in Atlanta.

files.f1: A woman named Shanell Rivers put blood and dog feces into various products at a Starbucks in Atlanta.

evidences.text: A Starbucks spokeswoman said Monday that the Facebook post “is completely false” and that Starbucks does not have an employee named Shanell Rivers.

130.text: Retailers are using "disappearing ink" on receipts to limit or enforce a strict window on returns.

files.f1: Retailers are using "disappearing ink" on receipts to limit or enforce a strict window on returns.

evidences.text: There is forum posts as far back as 2003 referenced the phenomenon but there is no clear evidence for purpose and most of the companies accept digital or printed mails according to their return policies.

131.text: Sears sold 'Free Palestine' shirts on its web site.

files.f1: Sears sold 'Free Palestine' shirts on its web site.

evidences.text: Shirts with the phrase "Free Palestine" were available for sale on the Sears web site but The shirts were sold by a third-party retailer and they're not available at the moment.

132.text: Uber purposely increased its prices in parts of London around the time of a terror attack in June 2017

files.f1: Uber purposely increased its prices in parts of London around the time of a terror attack in June 2017

evidences.text: This price surge happened automatically due to algorithms that observed increased demand, and was later stopped by the company. However, the company later apologized.

133.text: Babies born in-flight are given free air travel by all the airline firms for the rest of their lives.

files.f1: Babies born in-flight are given free air travel by all the airline firms for the rest of their lives.

evidences.text: The only airlines known to have given this privilege to children born in their metal are Thai Airways, Asia Pacific Airlines,

134.text: Entering your PIN in reverse at any ATM will automatically summon the police.

files.f1: Entering your PIN in reverse at any ATM will automatically summon the police.

evidences.text: There is no public report for the example of the situation and there is a denial statement declared by federal trade commision.

135.text: Burger King has introduced a new "adult meal" for Valentine's Day that includes a sex toy in Israel.

files.f1: Burger King has introduced a new "adult meal" for Valentine's Day that includes a sex toy in Israel.

evidences.text: Burger King Israel shared an image and a video of a Valentine's Day "adult meal," including toys geared to grownups.

136.text: Is there a secret symbolism on Oreo Cookies?

files.f1: Is there a secret symbolism on Oreo Cookies?

evidences.text: It was modeled after that of another product, Hydrox, which also had an embossed pattern on its face and design evolved over time and there is an article written by American architectural critic Paul Goldberger explains that how the cookie’s form “leaps across stylistic boundaries” to epitomize modernism.

137.text: Nordstrom sells a rock in a leather pouch for $85, and a smaller version for $65.

files.f1: Nordstrom sells a rock in a leather pouch for $85, and a smaller version for $65.

evidences.text: Nordstrom official web site still has the sale, but it seems to sold out.

138.text: United Airlines will begin charging for overhead bin space.

files.f1: United Airlines will begin charging for overhead bin space.

evidences.text: No portion of the fare's terms restricts the use of overhead bins, the luggage restriction applies only to a small class of travelers opting in to the fare

139.text: The country of Sweden is officially moving to a 6-hour workday.

files.f1: The country of Sweden is officially moving to a 6-hour workday.

evidences.text: The Local responded to these rumors, explaining that while some businesses may be trying out a 6-hour workday, this change is a purely experimental and voluntary one that has not been mandated by law nor implemented nationwide

140.text: JetBlue is offering free flights to Orlando for family members and partners of the victims of the Pulse Nightclub shooting.

files.f1: JetBlue is offering free flights to Orlando for family members and partners of the victims of the Pulse Nightclub shooting.

evidences.text: Approved by company on the official blog.

141.text: Apple CEO Tim Cook wrote an open letter to customers explaining why the company was fighting a court order to unlock an iPhone tied to the San Bernardino attack.

files.f1: Apple CEO Tim Cook wrote an open letter to customers explaining why the company was fighting a court order to unlock an iPhone tied to the San Bernardino attack.

evidences.text: Official apple site released it.

142.text: A woman posing as a "sex robot" became pregnant and filed a child support claim against her unsuspecting customer.

files.f1: A woman posing as a "sex robot" became pregnant and filed a child support claim against her unsuspecting customer.

evidences.text: This story originated with, and was reported solely by, 8Shit — a fake news site whose disclaimer notes that the site’s content is “fiction”:

143.text: The FBI found $4 million in cash and two bodies in a storage unit belonging to the Democratic mayor of a Missouri town.

files.f1: The FBI found $4 million in cash and two bodies in a storage unit belonging to the Democratic mayor of a Missouri town.

evidences.text: This story originated with Ladies of Liberty, a site that is part of a network of fake news sites.The photograph of an FBI agent and a sheriff that accompanied the article was actually an unrelated picture from a 2016 child abuse investigation.

144.text: Heather Wick joked about having a slave as a maid in a Facebook post.

files.f1: Heather Wick joked about having a slave as a maid in a Facebook post.

evidences.text: She apologized for it and she said it was intended as a “satirical joke.”

145.text: A video shows an American Airline airplane on fire in January 2018.

files.f1: A video shows an American Airline airplane on fire in January 2018.

evidences.text: It was filmed in October 2016 at at O’Hare International Airport in Chicago and shows an engine fire on a Boeing 767.

146.text: A new law in Mississippi makes it legal for atheist doctors and nurses to refuse care to religious patients.

files.f1: A new law in Mississippi makes it legal for atheist doctors and nurses to refuse care to religious patients.

evidences.text: A satirical article on the web site The Science Post caused confusion in early 2018 by claiming that a new law allowed atheist health care providers to refuse to treat religious patients.The Science Post’s header image clearly states that the site’s content is satirical.

147.text: Stormy Daniels said in an interview that Donald Trump ordered little pizzas as toppings on a regular-sized pizza.

files.f1: Stormy Daniels said in an interview that Donald Trump ordered little pizzas as toppings on a regular-sized pizza.

evidences.text: It’s a satire, in the real transcript, Daniels says she doesn’t remember what Trump ordered for dinner.

148.text: The body of the Clintons' former housekeeper was found by Arkansas police.

files.f1: The body of the Clintons' former housekeeper was found by Arkansas police.

evidences.text: Neither police in Arkansas nor any legitimate news organization reported such a discovery, and the photograph that accompanied the article was an unrelated picture taken from a 2015 news report about students participating in a “Crime Scene re-enactment day” at West Suffolk College in the UK.

149.text: First Lady Melania Trump banned the White House staff from receiving flu shots.

files.f1: First Lady Melania Trump banned the White House staff from receiving flu shots.

evidences.text: Claims turned up on a number of disreputable web sites, their point of origin was a consistent purveyor of fake news and political disinformation.

150.text: Did an Irish Woman Legally Marry the Ghost of a Pirate From the 1700s?

files.f1: Did an Irish Woman Legally Marry the Ghost of a Pirate From the 1700s?

evidences.text: It’s not legal in the U.K. or Ireland to marry a deceased person, law does not expressly recognize their marriage.She claim that she is legally married—as was reported in the news in January 2018—is false.

files.f1: "Friends" tv show movie.

evidences.text: Smasher, a YouTube channel that makes “concept trailers” among other videos, uploaded the trailer on 12 January 2018, calling it a “teaser trailer concept” for a “Jennifer Aniston Friends Reunion Concept.”

152.text: Netflix creating a new 'Harry Potter' television series.

files.f1: Netflix creating a new 'Harry Potter' television series.

evidences.text: There is no official advertisement created by Netflix. Rumors and false news spread because of the fan fiction poster that posted on facebook.

153.text: Essential oils can be poisonous to cats.

files.f1: Essential oils can be poisonous to cats.

evidences.text: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (ASPCA) lists essential oils like eucalyptus, orange and lemon (among others) as being among the leading causes for tremors among cats.

154.text: Is This Kim Jong-Un Reading 'Fire and Fury'?

files.f1: Is This Kim Jong-Un Reading 'Fire and Fury'?

evidences.text: The real picture was taken at a Pyongyang laver processing factory in 2015.

155.text: President Donald Trump posted a suggestive comment on Twitter about his daughter's "skintight" dress.

files.f1: President Donald Trump posted a suggestive comment on Twitter about his daughter's "skintight" dress.

evidences.text: It was posted by @RealDonaldTrFan, a parody account that has no official ties to the White House.

156.text: A photograph shows Robert Mueller in Vietnam in 1969.

files.f1: A photograph shows Robert Mueller in Vietnam in 1969.

evidences.text: Mueller certainly served in the Vietnam War. However, he is not the man featured in this photograph. This image actually shows Ed Episcopo, a Vietnam veteran who served in the 25th Infantry Division.

157.text: President Trump said police and firefighters make too much money in order to justify eliminating some of their tax deductions.

files.f1: President Trump said police and firefighters make too much money in order to justify eliminating some of their tax deductions.

evidences.text: The BlueDotDaily.com article attached to this claim refers to a controversial tax bill passed in late 2017. A number of readers clearly only saw the headline and believed it to reflect a direct quote made by the President

158.text: No two snowflakes are exactly alike.

files.f1: No two snowflakes are exactly alike.

evidences.text: At the visual level, with expensive laboratory equipment, you can create snowflakes that look pretty much identical. At the molecular level, the chance of two identical snowflakes is so astronomically low that it is considered impossible.

159.text: 50 dead bodies were found off the coast of Cancún in Mexico.

files.f1: 50 dead bodies were found off the coast of Cancún in Mexico.

evidences.text: They are volunteers who took part in a June 2016 project by two journalists, Sara Cantos and José Luís Sanchez Hachero. Sanchez Hachero photographed the volunteers as they lay on a beach in the Spanish province of Cádiz.

160.text: Photographs show a border fence between the countries of Mexico and Guatemala.

files.f1: Photographs show a border fence between the countries of Mexico and Guatemala.

evidences.text: The photograph was taken by Matt Clark and published to the Defenders of Wildlife Blog in 2013, second image actually a picture of a fence that Israel built in 2013 third one is photograph of a portion of the Israeli West Bank barrier.

161.text: Pop star Lady Gaga is an 'hermaphrodite.'

files.f1: Pop star Lady Gaga is an 'hermaphrodite.'

evidences.text: Lady Gaga’s manager responded to rumors of the singer’s purported hermaphroditism with the brusque statement “This is completely ridiculous.”

162.text: A man named Shane Patrick Boyle died shortly after starting a GoFundMe fundraiser for insulin.

files.f1: A man named Shane Patrick Boyle died shortly after starting a GoFundMe fundraiser for insulin.

evidences.text: In February 2017, Shane Patrick Boyle started a GoFundMe campaign to raise money for “a month of insulin.” A few weeks later, he died after developing diabetic ketoacidosis.

163.text: President Trump posing beside Kremlin-linked lawyer Natalia Veselnitskaya.

files.f1: President Trump posing beside Kremlin-linked lawyer Natalia Veselnitskaya.

evidences.text: The woman pictured standing alongside President Trump is Yulya Alferova, an entrepreneur and lifestyle blogger. She posted the photograph to her Instagram account on 8 November 2016.

164.text: Mark Zuckerberg Retires from Facebook in 2018

files.f1: Mark Zuckerberg Retires from Facebook in 2018

evidences.text: Zuckerberg announced a plan to address his challenger in 2018

165.text: Donald Trump Imposes 30% Tariffs on Solar Panel Imports

files.f1: Donald Trump Imposes 30% Tariffs on Solar Panel Imports

evidences.text: President Trump signed a proclamation imposing tariffs on solar panels and other solar equipment on January 23, 2018.

166.text: Pope Francis Gives Pontifical Medal to Pro-Abortion Dutch Activist Lilianne Ploumen

files.f1: Pope Francis Gives Pontifical Medal to Pro-Abortion Dutch Activist Lilianne Ploumen

evidences.text: BNR Newsradio, an all-news station in the Netherlands, posted a short video of Lilianne Ploumen posing with the Pontifical Medal on December 22, 2017.

167.text: Sandra Bullock said if Hillary Clinton doesn’t like President Trump, she can “Leave and never come back again.”

files.f1: Sandra Bullock said if Hillary Clinton doesn’t like President Trump, she can “Leave and never come back again.”

evidences.text: A fabricated story, which has since been re-reported by various fringe and fake news websites.

168.text: A photograph shows Muhammad Ali with all of his winnings in 1964.

files.f1: A photograph shows Muhammad Ali with all of his winnings in 1964.

evidences.text: The photograph was originally taken for the cover of Sports Illustrated in February 1964. In the cover story, titled “My $1,000,000 Getaway,”

169.text: Scientists Discover A Drug That Regenerates Teeth?

files.f1: Scientists Discover A Drug That Regenerates Teeth?

evidences.text: So far, this procedure has only been tested on mice, and it is unlikely to make dentistry an obsolete profession.

170.text: President Donald Trump was pictured at a cross burning with the KKK.

files.f1: President Donald Trump was pictured at a cross burning with the KKK.

evidences.text: This image is a real photograph, but it depicts a lookalike figure and not the real Donald Trump.

171.text: The skeleton of a giant human was uncovered during gas exploration in Saudi Arabia.

files.f1: The skeleton of a giant human was uncovered during gas exploration in Saudi Arabia.

evidences.text: The image displayed above was taken from Worth1000 (now DesignCrowd), a site devoted to hosting contests in which entrants show off their skills at manipulating photographs using digital editing programs.

172.text: Is NASA Hiring Someone to Protect Earth from Aliens?

files.f1: Is NASA Hiring Someone to Protect Earth from Aliens?

evidences.text: In July 2017, NASA opened applications for the job of Planetary Protection Officer, a role primarily concerned with preventing contamination from Earth to other planets, while the job does have a mandate to prevent extraterrestrial contamination from entering Earth’s biosphere, most of the job involves working with missions to design systems that prevent them from accidentally bringing life with them to other worlds.

173.text: Former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani was suspended from Twitter after sending messages about Pizzagate.

files.f1: Former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani was suspended from Twitter after sending messages about Pizzagate.

evidences.text: While it is true that the @RudolphGiuliani account was suspended by Twitter after posting several messages about Pizzagate, this account was not verified, and this statement was not posted via any official channels. Giuliani also doesn’t have an official Twitter account.

174.text: Does Setting Your Twitter Location to Germany Block Nazi Content?

files.f1: Does Setting Your Twitter Location to Germany Block Nazi Content?

evidences.text: Certain national socialist, white nationalist and Nazi Twitter profiles are "withheld" from view when viewed by a Twitter user whose country is set to Germany but it's not entirely effective, and some Nazi-related accounts and content will persist.

175.text: A 101-year-old Italian woman gave birth after an ovarian transplant.

files.f1: A 101-year-old Italian woman gave birth after an ovarian transplant.

evidences.text: The claim is completely fabricated. The article swiped an unrelated image from a Reddit thread with the title, “101 years difference.” In that thread, the top-voted comment claimed.

files.f1: Live Panda Flown from China to U.S. in Business Class?

177.text: Americans crashed Canada's immigration web site immediately after Donald Trump was elected.

files.f1: Americans crashed Canada's immigration web site immediately after Donald Trump was elected.

evidences.text: The Canadian government confirmed that a “flood” of visitors from the United States was indeed what had crashed its site.

178.text: Does a Viral Video Show a Polar Bear Starving to Death?

files.f1: Does a Viral Video Show a Polar Bear Starving to Death?

evidences.text: Photographer Paul Nicklen posted the video on Facebook, garnering almost 30,000 shares within a week, as well as the attention of the national news media.

179.text: NFL Fines Pittsburgh Steelers $1M Each for Skipping National Anthem?

files.f1: NFL Fines Pittsburgh Steelers $1M Each for Skipping National Anthem?

evidences.text: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell did not impose any fine (much less one of a cool $1 million each) on the Pittsburgh players, nor did he hand down any other form of punishment or announce any disciplinary action against them. Reports of whopping fines supposedly levied against Steelers players are a fiction that originated with America’s Last Line of Defense, a fake news site.

180.text: Wedding in Poland that was called off due to the onset of World War II in 1939

files.f1: Wedding in Poland that was called off due to the onset of World War II in 1939

evidences.text: It  is an art installation (entitled “The Four Seasons of Vivaldi”) created along the road between Haut-bois and Faulx in Namur, Belgium, in 2001 by French conceptual artist/sculptor Patrick Demazeau.

181.text: A video shows a "fake" Melania Trump standing next to the president.

files.f1: A video shows a "fake" Melania Trump standing next to the president.

evidences.text: The footage was captured by filming a television screen showing a CNN report from 13 October 2017. When compared to the actual video available on CNN‘s web site, it’s apparent that the strange visual was caused by the TV screen and not a faux first lady.

182.text: There are small worms in bags of Lipton tea.

files.f1: There are small worms in bags of Lipton tea.

evidences.text: Lipton answered the rumor via Facebook with a statement and a video of their own.

183.text: Is Netflix Rebooting the 'Addams Family?' Series?

files.f1: Is Netflix Rebooting the 'Addams Family?' Series?

evidences.text: The video was originally posted to YouTube by a user named Alexia Bertha, along with a message explaining that she had created the trailer to encourage Netflix to make a reboot of the Addams Family.

184.text: Jay-Z recently punched a 12-year-old girl after she tried to take his picture.

files.f1: Jay-Z recently punched a 12-year-old girl after she tried to take his picture.

evidences.text: Jay-Z explained that the woman in the footage was actually his good friend music executive Chaka Pilgrim, who is currently the president of Roc Nation Records. A video purportedly showing Jay-Z punching a young girl gets passed around the internet from time to time, in an apparent attempt to smear the musician. This clip first appeared in a 2000 documentary called Backstage about Jay-Z’s Hard Knock Life Tour.
